snippet: A judicial panel’s suggestion that Judge Fuller, who resigned after an arrest, could still be impeached was seen as a broader message that the judiciary was embracing a harder line.
abstract: Judicial Conference of the United States tells Congress there is plausible reason to impeach former Federal District Court Judge Mark Fuller of Alabama, who resigned from bench in May after being accused of domestic violence; experts say committee's statement is intended to demonstrate its willingness to take hard line against judicial misconduct.
lead_paragraph: A judicial panel’s suggestion that Judge Fuller, who resigned after an arrest, could still be impeached was seen as a broader message that the judiciary was embracing a harder line.

headline.main: Mark Fuller, Former Federal District Court Judge, Could Be Impeached

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Judicial Conference of the United States
